results.title: Anatomy of a murder
results.brief_description: A riveting courtroom drama of rape and premeditated murder is brought to life with an all-star cast in Otto Preminger’s suspenseful and highly acclaimed production. Packed with drama, passion and intrigue, the film pits humble small-town lawyer, Jimmy Stewart against hard-headed city prosecutor, George C. Scott. Emotions flare as jealous army lieutenant, Ben Gazzara pleads innocent to murdering the rapist of his seductive, beautiful wife, Lee Remick. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations and featuring a brilliant score by Duke Ellington, this film is a masterpiece that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Based on the novel by Robert Traver.

results.title: The Last days of Chez Nous
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Jan Chapman and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description: Beth (Lisa Harrow) is a successful novelist who runs her career and inner-city household, “Chez Nous” with great energy and humour, despite her hectic life with her French husband (Bruno Ganz), her carefree teenage daughter (Miranda Otto) and a new boarder (Kiri Paramore). The return of her younger sister, Vicky (Kerry Fox) sparks a chain of events which escalate in the intense heat of an Australian Summer and could spell the last days of “Chez Nous”. Also stars Bill Hunter.

results.title: Room at the top
results.creator_credit: Jack Clayton, John Woolf and Remus Films
results.brief_description: Based on John Braine’s best-seller and directed by Jack Clayton, the top-notch cast, steamy sex scenes and candid exploration of class-divided Britain had critics hailing it as one of the most vivid stories of modern times. Determined to make it to the top, returned serviceman, Joe Lampton (Laurence Harvey) pursues the daughter of the richest man in town (Heather Sears). At the same time, irresistibly drawn to an older, married woman (Simone Signoret), Lampton becomes tangled in a web of lies and deceit which can only end in tragedy. Nominated for six Oscars and honoured with Academy Awards for Best Actress and Best Screenplay, this film is truly a great British classic.

results.title: The Student prince
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Edmund Purdom and Ann Bltyh star in this romantic musical set to the music of Sigmund Romberg. Prince Karl is in love, but not with the princess he is supposed to wed in a state-arranged marriage. The object of his affections is a mere Heildberg barmaid. Mario Lanza provided the singing for the film.

results.title: Unforgiven
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Malpaso Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood’s film is an exciting modern classic that rode off with four 1992 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Director. Eastwood and Morgan Freeman play retired down-on-their-luck outlaws who pick up their guns one last time to collect a bounty offered by the vengeful prostitutes of the remote Wyoming town of Big Whiskey. Richard Harris is an ill-fated interloper, a colourful killer for hire called English Bob. Gene Hackman is the sly and brutal local sheriff whose brand of law enforcement ranges from unconventional to ruthless. Big trouble is coming to Big Whiskey.

results.title: Witness for the prosecution
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Arthur Hornblow and Theme Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Billy Wilder’s acclaimed 1957 courtroom melodrama based on Agatha Christie’s hit London play left audiences reeling from its surprise twists and shocking climax. Charles Laughton, Tyrone Power, Marlene Dietrich and Elsa Lanchester make this Oscar nominated classic a rivetiing experience. When a wealthy widow is found murdered, her married suitor, Leonard Vole (Power) is accused of the crime. At his trial, everyone is stunned when the prosecution calls Vole’s wife (Dietrich) to testify against him. Now it is more difficult than ever for Vole’s flamboyant defence attorney (Laughton) to prove that his client is innocent.

results.title: The Ploughman's lunch
results.creator_credit: Richard Eyre, Ann Scott, Simon Relph and Greenpoint Films
results.brief_description: Reporter James Penfield makes his money rearranging the facts, a talent he ruthlessly exploits in his friendship and love affairs. A political drama set against the backdrop of the Falkland’s crisis, the film takes a wry look at the Government’s attempt to justify the war. Set in the heartland of bourgeois England among media creators and academics, the personal, political and historical deceit of Thatcher’s Britain is ruthlessly exposed. Stars Jonathan Pryce and Tim Curry and features an astonishing climax as the crew and cast filmed undercover during the Conservative Party Conference.

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson
results.creator_credit: Peter Boita, Ken Annakin, Bill Anderson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
One of Disney’s biggest and most fondly remembered films, chronicles the exploits of the Robinson family after they are shipwrecked on a deserted island. Using teamwork and ingenuity, they skillfully overcome the obstacles of nature but the ultimate challenge lies ahead when a band of pirates threatens their paradise. Stars John Mills, Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur and Janet Munro.
From the novel “Swiss Family Robinson” by Johann Wyss

results.title: Weekend at Bernies (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ted Kotcheff, Victor Drai, Gladden Entertainment and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Larry and Richard have just discovered a fraud and embezzlement scheme that’s costing the insurance company they work for millions. Their Mafia connected boss Bernie is behind the crime and invites them for a weekend so he can rub them out. After some major bungling, it’s Bernie who ends up dead and Larry and Richard have to convince everyone Bernie is alive. As the tagline states, “for a corpse, Bernie sure gets around.” Cast includes Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart and Terry Kiser.

results.title: The Witches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Mark Shivas, Jim Henson Productions and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: When nine year old Luke and his grandmother go for a quiet seaside holiday, they stumble upon a witches’ convention, hosted by the Grand High Witch, (Angelica Huston). When Luke becomes a victim of the witches’ scheme to rid Britain of all its children, by transforming them into mice, he devises a plot with his grandmother to finally rid the world of witches. Based on the book by Roald Dahl.
